block.p: Stephanie Allison Heck, the daughter of Janet W. Kemp of Trumbull, Conn., and William R. Heck of Chattanooga, Tenn., is to be married today to Dr. Edward Stuart Brodkin, the son of Dr. Adele M. Brodkin and Dr. Roger H. Brodkin of Florham Park, N.J. Judge Jonathan E. Silbert of State Superior Court in New Haven is to officiate at the weekend home of the bridegroom's parents in Branford, Conn.

The bride, 27, graduated from Vassar College and received a master's degree in clinical psychology from Pennsylvania State University, where she is a candidate for a Ph.D. in clinical psychology. Her father is a lawyer in Chattanooga. Her mother has a translation business in Trumbull. The bride is the stepdaughter of Diane H. Heck and of Randall S. Kemp.

Stephanie Allison Heck, the daughter of Janet W. Kemp of Trumbull, Conn., and William R. Heck of Chattanooga, Tenn., is to be married today to Dr. Edward Stuart Brodkin, the son of Dr. Adele M. Brodkin and Dr. Roger H. Brodkin of Florham Park, N.J. Judge Jonathan E. Silbert of State Superior Court in New Haven is to officiate at the weekend home of the bridegroom's parents in Branford, Conn.

The bride, 27, graduated from Vassar College and received a master's degree in clinical psychology from Pennsylvania State University, where she is a candidate for a Ph.D. in clinical psychology. Her father is a lawyer in Chattanooga. Her mother has a translation business in Trumbull. The bride is the stepdaughter of Diane H. Heck and of Randall S. Kemp.
The bridegroom, 34, is a psychiatrist and a postdoctoral fellow conducting genetic research at Princeton University. He received a bachelor's degree magna cum laude and an M.D. from Harvard.

His mother, a psychologist, is a consultant on child development to Scholastic, the educational publisher. She is also a writer. His father is a dermatologist in West Orange, N.J. The bridegroom's parents are also professors at the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey in Newark.
